arm_group.description: Newborns, who will be monitored by amplitude integrated electroencephalography (aEEG) and near infrared spectroscopy (NIRS) during poractant instillation.
Newborns who will be monitored by aEEG and NIRS during beractant instillation

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the study is to determine whether there are differences in bioelectrical
      function (measured by amplitude integrated electroencephalography) and brain oxygenation
      (measured by near infrared spectroscopy) while and after instillation of two different
      surfactant preparations.

clinical_study.brief_title: Brain Oxygenation and Function of Preterm Newborns During Administration of Two Different Surfactant Preparations

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  26-30 gestational age

          -  surfactant instillation

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  congenital heart disease

          -  congenital central nervous disorder

          -  congenital genetic disorders

intervention.description: aEEG and NIRS monitoring during poractant alfa instilation
aEEG and NRs monitoring during beractant instillation

clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the Cerebral Tissue Oxygenation and the Bioelectrical Brain Activity of Preterm Newborns During Administration of Two Different Surfactant

other_outcome.description: Expiratory tidal volume (Vte), minute ventilation(MV) and dynamic compliance are going to be measured.
other_outcome.measure: Differences in pulmonary function parameters while using two different surfactant preparations.

primary_outcome.measure: Bandwidth, lower and upper margin of amplitude integrated signal while using two different surfactant preparations (beractant and poractant.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of brain oxygenation (rSO2) while using two different surfactant preparations (beractant and poractant).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
